column4: Hello, can someone please help me install my ati driver? I have a dell inspiron 1525.
have you tried the hardware manager?
use gksudo synaptic
sudo is for command line only, "gksudo" is for graphical applications
are you sure Hardware Manager doesn't have an ati driver for you?
ok, what are you looking for in synaptic?
how is that going to help you if you don't have an ati card ?
ah, I see
you don't need to remove any -- the system will automatically offer to remove then when they aren't in use
it won't tell you to remove it yet
the one you're looking for should be easy to find, because it will be the only one installed
for future reference, a green square in synaptic means the package is installed. Right click to remove it
just unintsall any that are green
probably not. Effects don't usually work with integrated graphics, I think
but don't quote me on that
it's a debugging/helping tool
close synaptic first
did you check ubuntu software center?
you'd probably to best to stick with easy to install options
I agree with Sa[i]nT , try transmission
there should be a readme inside it. bz2 is a compressed file, similar to .zip or .rar
in Ubuntu, it's often best to not install the latest version of software
the ones in the software repositories are tested to be stable, whereas the ones from vuze.com may not work
